Set the Euler angles to -90.0, 0.0, -90.0, and the translation vector to 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. This will set up the initial coordinate system for this part. 1. **Sketching the first face** Create the first face, which will contain several loops and curves. - Loop 1: Draw arc_1 from (0.0, 0.011) to (0.011, 0.0), followed by line_1 from (0.011, 0.0) to (0.739, 0.0). Draw arc_2 from (0.739, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.011), followed by line_2 from (0.75, 0.011) to (0.75, 0.0357). Draw arc_3 from (0.75, 0.0357) to (0.7388, 0.0467), followed by line_3 from (0.7388, 0.0467) to (0.0109, 0.036). Complete the loop by drawing arc_4 from (0.0109, 0.036) to (0.0, 0.025), followed by line_4 from (0.0, 0.025) to (0.0, 0.011). This creates the taper on this end of the part. - Loop 2: Draw a small circle_1 with its center at (0.3088, 0.0202) and a radius of 0.0014, which creates a hole in the part. - Loop 3: Draw another small circle_1 with its center at (0.7114, 0.0202) and a radius of 0.0034, which is the second hole in the part. 2. **Extruding the Sketch** Extrude the sketch with an extrusion depth of 0.0165 towards the normal, and 0.0 opposite the normal. Scale the sketch by 0.75. This creates a new solid body with a cylindrical shape and two holes. Use "NewBodyFeatureOperation" boolean operation to combine this part with previously constructed CAD models. **Part 2: Tapered Cylinder with Ridges** Create the coordinate system with Euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and 180.0. Adjust the translation vector according to the position of the part in the assembly: (0.0069, 0.972, 0.0). 1. **Sketching the first face** Create a new face and loop containing a single circle_1. - Loop 1: Draw circle_1 with its center at (0.0014, 0.0014) and a radius of 0.0014. 2. **Extruding the Sketch** Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.0, and in the opposite direction by 0.0457. Scale the sketch by 0.0028. Use "CutFeatureOperation" boolean operation to subtract this volume from the previous part. Your CAD models should now be complete, according to the given specifications and JSON file. The final model will resemble a thin, rectangular object with a slightly tapered end, and a second part that is a tapered cylinder with ridges.</description>
